author: Richard Phillips
method: Season the steak strips with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Heat the olive oil in a pan, then fry the steak for 1-2 minutes on both sides (for medium), or until cooked to your liking. Remove from the pan and allow to rest on a warm plate.  For the guacamole, mash the avocado and garlic together with a fork, and then mix in the remaining guacamole ingredients. To serve, wrap the steak, guacamole and yoghurt up in two tortilla wrap.
ingredients: 100g/3½oz fillet steak, cut into strips,  salt and freshly ground black pepper,  1 tbsp olive oil,  1 ripe avocado, skinned and chopped,  1 garlic clove, crushed to a paste,  1 tbsp olive oil,  ½ lime, zest and juice,  ½ beef tomato, chopped,  2 tbsp chopped fresh coriander,  2 tortilla wraps,  2 tbsp Greek-style yoghurt
